<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><span><strong style="color:#000">Good morning.</strong> Yesterday marked exactly a year until the 2020 U.S. election, and we’re all about to be hit with a tsunami of news, analysis, and poorly conceived memes.</span></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><span class="c-mrkdwn__br" data-stringify-type="paragraph-break"></span><span><strong style="color:#000">The Brew is here to help.</strong> Tomorrow, we’re launching a weekly newsletter that will help you wade through the information onslaught and give you a business-meets-politics angle you won't find anywhere else. </span></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><span>It’s called The Turnout. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/the-turnout/?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=turnout&email={email}" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Subscribe right now</a> or scroll down for more info. </span></p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENERGY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/03/saudi-arabia-announces-aramco-ipo-plans?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Aramco's IPO Gets the Green Flag
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="oil refinery" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcyODAxNzk4LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Sunday, Saudi Arabia finally <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/11/03/saudi-aramco-ipo-domestic-listing-set-to-begin-trading-in-december.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">went public</a> about Aramco’s plans to go public. The state-owned oil company will list an undisclosed amount of shares on the country's domestic stock exchange, the Tadawul, in December.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Aramco is a hugely profitable enterprise</strong>. Its net income of $111 billion last year topped those of Apple, Exxon Mobil, and Alphabet combined. Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman (MBS) had initially targeted a $2 trillion valuation, but that’s reportedly looking more like about $1.5 trillion. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>With so much money on the table, Wall St. has descended on Aramco like it released a new fried chicken sandwich. More than 20 global banks including Citigroup and JPMorgan have been tapped to work on the deal, </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-11-03/saudi-capital-market-regulator-approves-aramco-ipo-k2ijnnsq?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reports Bloomberg</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It’s on track to be the largest IPO in history. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">This has not been a smooth ride</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It turns out accomplishing the world’s biggest IPO isn’t easy. The Saudi government has attempted to take Aramco public for years, <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2018/08/22/business/dealbook/saudi-aramco-ipo.html?module=inline&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">beset by delays</a> involving disputes over the company’s valuation and the location of the listing. Plus, in September an Aramco processing facility was hit by a drone attack.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But it looks like with a little scaling back, the IPO is finally a go. Saudi Arabia certainly feels like it’s necessary. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The country will funnel the proceeds from the IPO into its sovereign wealth fund, the Public Investment Fund (PIF). We last met PIF as a major shareholder in Uber and as the (possible) source of Elon Musk’s crazy buyout plans for Tesla, which were ultimately scrapped.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>As the </span><span><a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/11/03/business/dealbook/aramco-ipo.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">NYT notes</a></span><span>, PIF is doing most of the heavy lifting in diversifying the country’s economy away from natural resources and toward high-tech industries. Those plans include Neom, a futuristic city that’ll cost $500 billion to build from scratch. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>stay tuned for Aramco’s IPO prospectus on Nov. 9.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
C-SUITE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/03/easterbrook-mcdonaldsover-consensual-relationship?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Easterbrook Out at McDonald’s
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="a mcdonald's clock" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=447 src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1572822229.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="a mcdonald's clock" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1572822229.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s one thing to send a work email on a Sunday, it’s another to send a work email disclosing you’ve been fired for demonstrating “poor judgment.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Such is life for McDonald’s former CEO Steve Easterbrook, who was <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-11-03/mcdonald-s-fires-ceo-easterbrook-over-relationship-with-employee?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">terminated</a> for engaging in a consensual relationship with an employee, violating company policy. In an email to employees, Easterbrook said, “This was a mistake” and “<span>I agree with the board that it is time for me to move on</span>.” </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Roll the tape</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Easterbrook had been head chef of McDonald’s since 2015. Shares have <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/11/03/mcdonalds-steve-easterbrook-is-out-as-ceo-due-to-a-consensual-relationship-with-an-employee.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">increased 96%</a> since he took over, but the company still faces challenges like shifting consumer food habits, workforce problems, and technological disruption.  </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">How Easterbrook dealt with that last one:</strong></span><span> McDonald’s has made </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2019/09/27/mcdonalds-pushes-emerging-tech-makeover?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">three tech acquisitions</a></span><span> this year, including a $300 million purchase of personalized data startup Dynamic Yield.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Next man up: </strong>McDonald’s USA President Chris Kempczinski, who plans to push forward with the tech overhaul.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HOSPITALITY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/03/airbnb-tightens-reservations-policies?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Airbnb Cracks Down on House Parties
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Airbnb is tightening its policies on unauthorized house parties in response to the shooting deaths of five people in an Orinda, California, rental home on Halloween. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">CEO Brian Chesky announced the new policy in a <a href="https://twitter.com/bchesky/status/1190675936754028544?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">series of tweets</a> Saturday. Here’s what’s changing: </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Airbnb is expanding manual screening of “high-risk” reservations that are flagged by its tech.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It’ll take “immediate action” against users who violate the new policies, including removal.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>It’s creating a dedicated party house rapid response team that’ll begin a “10 day sprint” to plan the implementation of these new measures.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>Already facing regulatory pressures and public backlash around the globe, Airbnb needs to get better at identifying risky reservations. In the case of the Halloween party, the renter told the host she wanted to move her family to escape wildfire smoke, <a href="https://apnews.com/1cae18ea329e481e8e9607fd687b61c6?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reports the AP</a>. That night, over 100 people showed up to the house.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Chesky: “We must do better, and we will. This is unacceptable.”</p>

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Get ready to see a lot of that ^. </p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Tuesday: </strong>International trade; earnings (Match Group, Mallinckrodt, Tapestry); Election Day</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Wednesday: </strong>Earnings (CVS, Roku, Square, Qualcomm, Baidu, Wendy’s); Saxophone Day marks the 205th anniversary of the birth of Adolphe Sax, the instrument’s inventor</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Thursday: </strong>Jobless claims; consumer credit; earnings (AMC, Teva, Disney, Booking Holdings, Keurig Dr Pepper, Activision Blizzard, Dropbox)</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Friday: </strong>Consumer sentiment; lots of New York Comedy Festival events </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY MONDAY.COM
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
That Wasn’t an Ad
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Dear reader,</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">I recently wrote to you apologizing for forgetting my <a href="http://go.thoughtleaders.io/1277820191104" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">monday.com</a> password. Your responses indicate none of you care about my traumatic experience.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You wrote things like “That <a href="http://go.thoughtleaders.io/1277820191104" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">monday.com</a> ad was brilliant,” “That plug for <a href="http://go.thoughtleaders.io/1277820191104" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">monday.com</a> was some of the best ad copy I’ve seen in awhile,” and “Your non-ad for <a href="http://go.thoughtleaders.io/1277820191104" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">monday.com</a> is hilarious.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">There is nothing hilarious about my feelings. And <em>that wasn’t an ad</em>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">All you care about is <a href="http://go.thoughtleaders.io/1277820191104" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">monday.com</a>’s visual organization. <a href="http://go.thoughtleaders.io/1277820191104" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">monday.com</a>’s project management tools. <a href="http://go.thoughtleaders.io/1277820191104" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">monday.com</a>, <a href="http://go.thoughtleaders.io/1277820191104" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">monday.com</a>, <a href="http://go.thoughtleaders.io/1277820191104" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">monday.com</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Nancy’s response haunts me most: “You gave me a good laugh, thank you again.” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Oh yeah, Nancy? My forgetting my <a href="http://go.thoughtleaders.io/1277820191104" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">monday.com</a> password–an event that tanked my productivity and flung my workflow into chaos–was <em>funny to you</em>? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">I guess I pale in comparison to <a href="http://go.thoughtleaders.io/1277820191104" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">monday.com</a>’s prolific organization techniques.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A feelings-less copywriter who will now only <a href="http://go.thoughtleaders.io/1277820191104" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">log into monday.com and accomplish work tasks with ease</a>,</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Henry</p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/03/weeks-earnings-tell-us?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Week Ahead: Part 2
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="airplane flying into sunset " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcyNzk5ODU3LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Gerhard Gellinger from Pixabay</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Notice a theme in the companies reporting earnings this week? Many are in the travel/leisure industry, spanning hotel chains to online booking giants. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">These reports will tell us important information about how various macroeconomic forces are playing out IRL, <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-stocks-weekahead/wall-street-week-ahead-travel-leisure-company-reports-set-to-give-view-of-economy-consumer-idUSKBN1XB3YG?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">says Reuters</a>. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Take currency. </strong></span><span>Earnings from a company like Marriott could help shed light on whether the strong U.S. dollar has foreign visitors opting for staycations.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Consumer spending, too. </strong></span><span>Disney will keep the focus on its new streaming service, but also pay attention to profits at its theme parks. When people are feeling good about the overall economy, they’re more willing to shell out for Mickey Mouse cufflinks. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out on earnings season: </strong>Of the S&P companies that have reported so far, more than 75% have topped expectations, <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/earnings-tide-lifts-most-stocks-11572773400?mod=hp_lead_pos7&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">writes the WSJ</a>. Plus, 66% of companies’ shares gained in the next trading session. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Then again, it’s pretty easy to jump over a bar that’s underground. S&P companies are projected to post a 0.8% decline in Q3 earnings.</p>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">

<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Just kidding. But we <em>are</em> venturing into the third deadly sin of conversation topics—politics. Tomorrow, we’ll press send on The Turnout, a new weekly newsletter focused on the intersection of business and politics. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why? </strong>Well, for one thing, there’s a pretty big election happening. And also, politics and business go together like peanut butter, jelly, and clichés. Think about… </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The trade war </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The debate over whether to break up Big Tech </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The $6 billion political consulting industry</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You’ll hear about all of those, plus…</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Plain English explanations of things like filibustering, gerrymandering, and partisan pandering. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Zoom-ins on state and local issues. We may even cover your little cousin’s bid for middle school president. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>All the best biz/politics content the internet has to offer, curated for you.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">In short:</strong> If you know you should follow politics, but aren’t thrilled with the news, The Turnout is for you. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/the-turnout/?utm_source=morning_brew&utm_medium=newsletter&utm_campaign=turnout&email={email}" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Sign up here</a>.</p>

style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nAramco's IPO Gets the Green Flag\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"oil refinery\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTcyODAxNzk4LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eGetty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Sunday, Saudi Arabia finally \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/11/03/saudi-aramco-ipo-domestic-listing-set-to-begin-trading-in-december.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewent public\u003c/a\u003e about Aramco’s plans to go public. The state-owned oil company will list an undisclosed amount of shares on the country's domestic stock exchange, the Tadawul, in December.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAramco is a hugely profitable enterprise\u003c/strong\u003e. Its net income of $111 billion last year topped those of Apple, Exxon Mobil, and Alphabet combined. Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman (MBS) had initially targeted a $2 trillion valuation, but that’s reportedly looking more like about $1.5 trillion. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eWith so much money on the table, Wall St. has descended on Aramco like it released a new fried chicken sandwich. More than 20 global banks including Citigroup and JPMorgan have been tapped to work on the deal, \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-11-03/saudi-capital-market-regulator-approves-aramco-ipo-k2ijnnsq?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereports Bloomberg\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt’s on track to be the largest IPO in history. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThis has not been a smooth ride\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt turns out accomplishing the world’s biggest IPO isn’t easy. The Saudi government has attempted to take Aramco public for years, \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2018/08/22/business/dealbook/saudi-aramco-ipo.html?module=inline\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebeset by delays\u003c/a\u003e involving disputes over the company’s valuation and the location of the listing. Plus, in September an Aramco processing facility was hit by a drone attack.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut it looks like with a little scaling back, the IPO is finally a go. Saudi Arabia certainly feels like it’s necessary. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe country will funnel the proceeds from the IPO into its sovereign wealth fund, the Public Investment Fund (PIF). We last met PIF as a major shareholder in Uber and as the (possible) source of Elon Musk’s crazy buyout plans for Tesla, which were ultimately scrapped.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eAs the \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/11/03/business/dealbook/aramco-ipo.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eNYT notes\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, PIF is doing most of the heavy lifting in diversifying the country’s economy away from natural resources and toward high-tech industries. Those plans include Neom, a futuristic city that’ll cost $500 billion to build from scratch. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003estay tuned for Aramco’s IPO prospectus on Nov. collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s one thing to send a work email on a Sunday, it’s another to send a work email disclosing you’ve been fired for demonstrating “poor judgment.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSuch is life for McDonald’s former CEO Steve Easterbrook, who was \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-11-03/mcdonald-s-fires-ceo-easterbrook-over-relationship-with-employee?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eterminated\u003c/a\u003e for engaging in a consensual relationship with an employee, violating company policy. In an email to employees, Easterbrook said, “This was a mistake” and “\u003cspan\u003eI agree with the board that it is time for me to move on\u003c/span\u003e.” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eRoll the tape\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eEasterbrook had been head chef of McDonald’s since 2015. Shares have \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/11/03/mcdonalds-steve-easterbrook-is-out-as-ceo-due-to-a-consensual-relationship-with-an-employee.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eincreased 96%\u003c/a\u003e since he took over, but the company still faces challenges like shifting consumer food habits, workforce problems, and technological disruption.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eHow Easterbrook dealt with that last Parties\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAirbnb is tightening its policies on unauthorized house parties in response to the shooting deaths of five people in an Orinda, California, rental home on Halloween. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eCEO Brian Chesky announced the new policy in a \u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/bchesky/status/1190675936754028544?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eseries of tweets\u003c/a\u003e Saturday. Here’s what’s changing: \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAirbnb is expanding manual screening of “high-risk” reservations that are flagged by its tech.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt’ll take “immediate action” against users who violate the new policies, including removal.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIt’s creating a dedicated party house rapid response team that’ll begin a “10 day sprint” to plan the implementation of these new measures.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eAlready facing regulatory pressures and public backlash around the globe, Airbnb needs to get better at identifying risky reservations. In the case of the Halloween party, the renter told the host she wanted to move her family to escape wildfire smoke, \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/1cae18ea329e481e8e9607fd687b61c6?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereports the AP\u003c/a\u003e. That night, over 100 people showed up to the house.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eChesky: “We must do better, and we will. Many are in the travel/leisure industry, spanning hotel chains to online booking giants. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThese reports will tell us important information about how various macroeconomic forces are playing out IRL, \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-usa-stocks-weekahead/wall-street-week-ahead-travel-leisure-company-reports-set-to-give-view-of-economy-consumer-idUSKBN1XB3YG?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esays Reuters\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eTake currency. \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eEarnings from a company like Marriott could help shed light on whether the strong U.S. dollar has foreign visitors opting for staycations.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eConsumer spending, too. \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eDisney will keep the focus on its new streaming service, but also pay attention to profits at its theme parks. When people are feeling good about the overall economy, they’re more willing to shell out for Mickey Mouse cufflinks. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out on earnings season: \u003c/strong\u003eOf the S\u0026P companies that have reported so far, more than 75% have topped expectations, \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/earnings-tide-lifts-most-stocks-11572773400?mod=hp_lead_pos7\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewrites the WSJ\u003c/a\u003e. Plus, 66% of companies’ shares gained in the next trading session. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThen again, it’s pretty easy to jump over a bar that’s underground.
